maml:description.maml:para: Adds a firewall rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreFirewallRule cmdlet adds a firewall rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to add the firewall rule to
The name of the firewall rule to add.
The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
Name of resource group under which the account to add the firewall rule is.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The Data Lake Store account to add the firewall rule to
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The end of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
The name of the firewall rule to add.
Name of resource group under which the account to add the firewall rule is.
The start of the valid ip range for the firewall rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a new firewall rule to a Data Lake Store account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This creates a new firewall rule called "MyRule" in account "ContosoADL" with an IP range of 127.0.0.1 - 127.0.0.2

maml:description.maml:para: Adds content to an item in a Data Lake Store.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemContent cmdlet adds content to an item in an Azure Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.
Specifies the encoding for the item to create. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Unknown
- String
- Unicode
- Byte
- BigEndianUnicode
- UTF8
- UTF7
- Ascii
- Default
- Oem
- BigEndianUTF32
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the encoding for the item to create. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Unknown
- String
- Unicode
- Byte
- BigEndianUnicode
- UTF8
- UTF7
- Ascii
- Default
- Oem
- BigEndianUTF32
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the content to add to the item.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add content to a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command adds content to the file myFile.txt.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a trusted identity provider to the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreTrustedIdProvider cmdlet adds a trusted identity provider to the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the Data Lake Store account to add the specified trusted identity provider to.
The name of the trusted identity provider to add
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>"
Name of resource group under which the account to add the trusted identity provider is.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the Data Lake Store account to add the specified trusted identity provider to.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The name of the trusted identity provider to add
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>"
Name of resource group under which the account to add the trusted identity provider is.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Add a trusted identity provider

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds the provider "MyProvider" to account "ContosoADL" with the provider endpoint "https://sts.windows.net/6b04908c-b91f-40ce-8024-7ee8a4fd6150"

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a virtual network rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule cmdlet adds a virtual network rule to the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to add the virtual network rule to
The name of the virtual network rule.
The subnetId of the virtual network rule
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The Data Lake Store account to add the virtual network rule to
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the virtual network rule.
The subnetId of the virtual network rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Add-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule -Account "dls" -Name "myVNET" -SubnetId "testId"
ResourceGroupName : AccountName : VirtualNetworkRuleName : myVNET VirtualNetworkSubnetId : /subscriptions/<subscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroup>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/myVNET/subnets/testId IgnoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint : State :

dev:remarks.maml:para: This creates a new virtual network rule called "myVNET" in account "dls" with a subnet id "testId"

maml:description.maml:para: Attempts to enable a user managed Key Vault for encryption of the specified Data Lake Store account.
The Enable-AzureRmDataLakeStoreKeyVault cmdlet attempts to enable a user managed Key Vault for encryption of the specified Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to enable the user managed Key Vault for
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Name of resource group associated with the account. If not specified will attempt to be discovered.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The Data Lake Store account to enable the user managed Key Vault for
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Name of resource group associated with the account. If not specified will attempt to be discovered.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Enable the Key Vault for the ContosoADLS account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command attempts to enable the user managed Key Vault for the Data Lake Store account named ContosoADLS.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the properties (Disk usage and Acl) for the entire tree from the specified path to a ouput path
The Export-AzureRmDataLakeStoreChildItemProperties is used to report the ADLS space usage or/and ACL usage for the given directory and it's sub directories and files.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to execute the filesystem operation in
The path in the specified Data Lake account that should be retrieve. Can be a file or folder In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.
Path to output file. Can be a Local path or Adl Path. By default it is local. If SaveToAdl is pecified then it is an ADL path in the same account
Indicates the number of files/directories processed in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specification.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Retrieves the acl starting from the root path
Retrieves the disk usage starting from the root path

Do not show directory subtree if the ACLs are the same throughout the entire subtree. This makes it easier to see only the paths up to which the ACLs differ.For example if all files and folders under /a/b are the same, do not show the subtreeunder /a/b, and just output /a/b with 'True' in the Consistent ACL columnCannot be set if IncludeFiles is not set, because consistent Acl cannot be determined without retrieving acls for the files.
Show stats at file level (default is to show directory-level info only)
Maximum depth from the root directory till which disk usage or acl is displayed
Indicates a boolean response should be returned indicating the result of the delete operation.
If passed then saves the dump file to ADL. The DumpFile wil be a ADL path in that case
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The Data Lake Store account to execute the filesystem operation in
The path in the specified Data Lake account that should be retrieve. Can be a file or folder In the format '/folder/file.txt', where the first '/' after the DNS indicates the root of the file system.
Path to output file. Can be a Local path or Adl Path. By default it is local. If SaveToAdl is pecified then it is an ADL path in the same account
Indicates the number of files/directories processed in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specification.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Retrieves the acl starting from the root path

This makes it easier to see only the paths up to which the ACLs differ.For example if all files and folders under /a/b are the same, do not show the subtreeunder /a/b, and just output /a/b with 'True' in the Consistent ACL columnCannot be set if IncludeFiles is not set, because consistent Acl cannot be determined without retrieving acls for the files.

This makes it easier to see only the paths up to which the ACLs differ.For example if all files and folders under /a/b are the same, do not show the subtreeunder /a/b, and just output /a/b with 'True' in the Consistent ACL columnCannot be set if IncludeFiles is not set, because consistent Acl cannot be determined without retrieving acls for the files.
Show stats at file level (default is to show directory-level info only)

Path to output file. Can be a Local path or Adl Path. By default it is local. If SaveToAdl is pecified then it is an ADL path in the same account
Indicates a boolean response should be returned indicating the result of the delete operation.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the disk usage and ACL usage for all subdirectories and files

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the disk usage and ACL usage for all subdirectories and files under /a. IncludeFile ensures the usage is reported for files also

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get the ACL usage for all subdirectories and files with the consistent ACL hidden
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $fullAcl="user:contoso-userid:--x|user::rwx|other::---|group::rwx" PS C:\> $newFullAcl = $fullAcl.Split("{|}"); PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -Account ContosoADL -Path /a -Acl $newFullAcl -Recurse -Debug
PS C:\> Export-AzureRmDataLakeStoreChildItemProperties -Account ContosoADL -Path /a -OutputPath "C:\Users\contoso\Desktop\DumpFile.txt" -GetAcl -HideConsistentAcl -IncludeFile

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the ACL usage for all subdirectories and files under /a. IncludeFile ensures the usage is reported for files also. HideconsistentAcl in this case will show the Acl of /a, not it's children since all of the children has same acl as /a. This flag skips the acl ouput of subtree if all it's acls are same as the root.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a file from Data Lake Store.
The Export-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet downloads a file from Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Indicates that a folder download is recursive.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied are a continuation of a previous download. This will cause the system to attempt to resume from the last file that was not fully downloaded.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Indicates the number of files or chunks to download in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specifications.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Indicates the number of files or chunks to download in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specifications.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the local file path to which to download the file.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Specifies the path of the item to download from the Data Lake Store, starting from the root directory (/).
Indicates that a folder download is recursive.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied are a continuation of a previous download. This will cause the system to attempt to resume from the last file that was not fully downloaded.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: The path where the file or folder was downloaded to.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Download an item from the Data Lake Store

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command downloads the file TestSource.csv from the Data Lake Store to C:\Test.csv with a concurrency of 4.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the summary of total size, files and directories contained in the path specified

The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreChildItemSummary retrieves the content summary for a given path. It recursively computes total number of files, directories and total size of all the files under the given path.

Indicates the number of files/directories processed in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specification.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the specified firewall rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no firewall rule is specified, then lists all firewall rules for the account.
The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreFirewallRule cmdlet gets the specified firewall rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no firewall rule is specified, then lists all firewall rules for the account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to retrieve the firewall rule from.
The name of the firewall rule to retrieve
Name of resource group under which want to retrieve the specified account's specified firewall rule.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The Data Lake Store account to retrieve the firewall rule from.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The name of the firewall rule to retrieve
Name of resource group under which want to retrieve the specified account's specified firewall rule.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Retrieve a specific firewall rule

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the firewall rule named "MyFirewallRule" from account "ContosoADL"

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: List all firewall rules in an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all firewall rules in account "ContosoADL"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store. If no provider is specified, then lists all providers for the account.

The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreTrustedIdProvider cmdlet gets the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store. If no provider is specified, then lists all providers for the account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists all providers under the account "ContosoADL"

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the specified virtual network rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no virtual network rule is specified, then lists all virtual network rules for the account.

The Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule cmdlet gets the specified virtual network rules in the specified Data Lake Store. If no virtual network rule is specified, then lists all virtual network rules for the account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to get the virtual network rule from
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the virtual network rule.
The Data Lake Store account to get the virtual network rule from

The name of the virtual network rule.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule -Account "dls" -Name "myVNET"
ResourceGroupName : AccountName : VirtualNetworkRuleName : myVNET VirtualNetworkSubnetId : /subscriptions/<subscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroup>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/myVNET/subnets/testId IgnoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint : State :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the virtual network rule named "myVNET" from account "dls"

maml:description.maml:para: Uploads a local file or directory to a Data Lake Store.
The Import-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet uploads a local file or directory to a Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the local path of the file or folder to upload.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates that this operation should upload all items in all subfolders.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied are a continuation of a previous upload. This will cause the system to attempt to resume from the last file that was not fully uploaded.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied should be copied with no concern for new line preservation across appends.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Indicates the number of files or chunks to upload in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specifications.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Indicates the number of files or chunks to upload in parallel. Default will be computed as a best effort based on system specifications.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path to which to upload a file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Optionally indicates the diagnostic log level to use to record events during the file or folder import. Default is Error.
Specifies the path for the diagnostic log to record events to during the file or folder import.
Indicates that this operation can overwrite the destination file if it already exists.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied should be copied with no concern for new line preservation across appends.
Specifies the local path of the file or folder to upload.
Indicates that this operation should upload all items in all subfolders.
Indicates that the file(s) being copied are a continuation of a previous upload. This will cause the system to attempt to resume from the last file that was not fully uploaded.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: The full path in the Data Lake Store account to the uploaded file or folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an entry from the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Remove-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry cmdlet removes an entry (ACE) from the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item from which to remove an ACE, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of ACE to remove. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - User
- Group
- Mask
- Other
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal for which to remove an ACE.
Indicates that this operation removes the default ACE from the specified ACL.
Number of files/directories processed in parallel. Optional: a reasonable default will be selected
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates a boolean response should be returned indicating the result of the delete operation.
Indicates the ACL to be removed recursively to the child subdirectories and files
If passed then progress status is showed. Only applicable when recursive Acl remove is done.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies a Data Lake Store account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet modifies a Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the ID of an AzureActive Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Optionally enable or disable the existing trusted ID providers.
Optionally enable or disable existing firewall rules.
Optionally allow/block Azure originating IPs through the firewall.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
If the encryption type is User assigned, the user can rotate their key version with this parameter.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Optionally allow/block Azure originating IPs through the firewall.
Specifies the ID of an AzureActive Directory group. This group is the default group for files and folders that you create.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Optionally enable or disable existing firewall rules.
If the encryption type is User assigned, the user can rotate their key version with this parameter.
Specifies the name of a Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the Data Lake Store account to modify.
Specifies tags as key-value pairs. You can use tags to identify a Data Lake Store account from other Azure resources.
The desired commitment tier for this account to use.
Optionally enable or disable the existing trusted ID providers.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl cmdlet modifies the access control list (ACL) of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Number of files/directories processed in parallel. Optional: a reasonable default will be selected.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates the resulting ACL should be returned.
Indicates the ACL to be set recursively to the child subdirectories and files
If passed then progress status is showed. Only applicable when recursive Acl set is done.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies an ACL for a file or a folder.
Number of files/directories processed in parallel. Optional: a reasonable default will be selected.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates the resulting ACL should be returned.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
Indicates the ACL to be set recursively to the child subdirectories and files
If passed then progress status is showed. Only applicable when recursive Acl set is done.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: If PassThru is specified, will return the resulting list of ACL entries.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the ACL for a file and a folder
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ACL = Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path / PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path "/MyFiles/Test.txt" -Acl $ACL

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ACL for the root directory of the ContosoADL account, and then stores it in the $ACL variable. The second command sets the ACL for the file Test.txt to the one in $ACL.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set the ACL for folder recursively
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$ACL = Get-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAclEntry -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path /Folder1 PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemAcl -AccountName "ContosoADL" -Path "/Folder2" -Acl $ACL -Recurse -Concurrency 128

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the ACL for the directory Folder1 of the ContosoADL account, and then stores it in the $ACL variable. The second command sets the ACL recursively to Folder2 and its sub directories and files to the one in $ACL.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an entry in the ACL of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

- ReadWrite

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Modify permissions for an ACE recursively
Example 3: Modify permissions for an ACE recursively using Acl object

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command recursively modifies the ACE for Patti Fuller to have all permissions to root and all its subdirectories and files.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets or removes the expire time for a file in an Azure Data Lake Store account.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemExpiry cmdlet sets or removes the expire time for a file in an Azure Data Lake Store account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file item for which to set or remove expiry.
The absolute expiration time for the specified file. If no value or set to MaxValue, the file will never expire.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file item for which to set or remove expiry.
Relative expiry options. RelativeToNow or RelativeToCreationDate are current options
The relative time in milliseconds with respect to now or creation time
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The absolute expiration time for the specified file. If no value or set to MaxValue, the file will never expire.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file item for which to set or remove expiry.
Relative expiry options. RelativeToNow or RelativeToCreationDate are current options
The relative time in milliseconds with respect to now or creation time
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the expiration time for a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets expiration on the file myfile.txt in account ContosoADL to be two hours from now. This will cause the file to expire (be marked for delete) in two hours.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Remove the expiration on a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes any expiration that was previously set on file 'myfile.txt' in account 'ContosoADL'. This means the file will not automatically expire (be marked for delete) and will need to be manually deleted or set to expire again.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Set expiration time for a file relative to now
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AdlStoreItemExpiry -Account "ContosoADL" -path /myfile.txt -RelativeFileExpiryOption RelativeToNow -RelativeTime 240000 PS C:\> Set-AdlStoreItemExpiry -Account "ContosoADL" -path /myfile.txt -RelativeFileExpiryOption RelativeToCreationDate -RelativeTime 240000

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command sets the expiration time of the file /myfile.txt 240 seconds relative to current time at server. The second command sets the expiration time of the file /myfile.txt 240 seconds relative to creation time at server.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemOwner cmdlet modifies the owner of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. The acceptable values for this parameter are: User and Group.
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates the resulting updated owner should be returned.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the object ID of the AzureActive Directory user, group, or service principal to use as the owner.
Indicates the resulting updated owner should be returned.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to modify, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of owner to set. The acceptable values for this parameter are: User and Group.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the owner for an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the owner for the root directory to Patti Fuller.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the permission octal of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItemPermission cmdlet modifies the permission octal of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
The permissions to set for the file or folder, expressed as an octal (e.g. '777')
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the Data Lake Store account name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the file or folder, starting with the root directory (/).
The permissions to set for the file or folder, expressed as an octal (e.g. '777')
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the permission octal for an item

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the permission octal for a file to 0770, which translates to clearing the sticky bit, setting read/write/execute permissions for the owner of the file, setting read/write/execute permissions for the owning group of the file, and clearing read/write/execute permissions for other.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreTrustedIdProvider cmdlet modifies the specified trusted identity provider in the specified Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to add the trusted identity provider to
The name of the trusted identity provider.
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to update the trusted identity provider for.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The Data Lake Store account to add the trusted identity provider to
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The name of the trusted identity provider.
The valid trusted provider endpoint in the format: https://sts.windows.net/<provider identity>
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to update the trusted identity provider for.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a Trusted Identity Provider Endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: This updates the provider endpoing for firewall rule "MyProvider" in account "ContosoADL" to "https://sts.windows.net/6b04908c-b91f-40ce-8024-7ee8a4fd6150"

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies the specified virtual network rule in the specified Data Lake Store.
The Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule cmdlet modifies the specified virtual network rule in the specified Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Data Lake Store account to update the virtual network rule in
The name of the virtual network rule.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The start of the valid ip range for the virtual network rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The Data Lake Store account to update the virtual network rule in
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the virtual network rule.
The start of the valid ip range for the virtual network rule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-AzureRmDataLakeStoreVirtualNetworkRule -Account "dls" -Name "myVNET" -SubnetId "updatedId"
ResourceGroupName : AccountName : VirtualNetworkRuleName : myVNET VirtualNetworkSubnetId : /subscriptions/<subscriptionId>/resourceGroups/<resourceGroup>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/myVNET/subnets/updatedId IgnoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint : State :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the subnet id of virtual network rule "myVNET" in account "dls" to "updatedId"

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreAccount cmdlet tests the existence of a Data Lake Store account.

Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account to test.
Specifies the name of the resource group that contains the account to test.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test an account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the account named ContosoADL exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.
The Test-AzureRmDataLakeStoreItem cmdlet tests the existence of a file or folder in Data Lake Store.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of item to test. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Any
- File
- Folder
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the Data Lake Store account.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Data Lake Store path of the item to test, starting with the root directory (/).
Specifies the type of item to test. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - Any
- File
- Folder

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Test a file

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests whether the file Test.csv exists in the ContosoADL account.
